heading: H1
content: Data-Driven Stress Testing: The Role of Deep Learning in Financial Risk Management

heading: BODY
content: PresentationofFindings Theresultsofthisstudyarepresentedthroughdescriptivestatistics,predictive modelperformancemetrics,andvisualizationssuchastablesandfigures.The findingsfocusonthepredictiveaccuracyofdeeplearningmodels(LSTM, Transformer)comparedtotraditionalfinancialstresstestingapproaches(VAR, LogisticRegression)andhighlightthemostimportantmacroeconomicindicators influencingfinancialdistressprediction. 1.ModelPerformanceComparison Thepredictiveperformanceofdeeplearningmodelswasevaluatedagainsttraditional statisticalmodels.Thefollowingtablepresentstheaccuracy,precision,recall,andF1- scoreforeachmodel: ModelAccuracy(%)PrecisionRecallF1-ScoreMSE LogisticRegression72.80.710.680.690.215 VAR75.20.730.700.710.198 LSTM86.70.880.850.860.112 Transformer89.20.910.870.890.095

heading: BODY
content: TheSHAPanalysisrevealedthatinterestrates,stockmarketvolatility(VIX), andinflationhadthemostsubstantialimpactonfinancialstresspredictions.This suggeststhatcentralbankpoliciesandmarketfluctuationsarekeydriversoffinancial risk,reinforcingconventionalfinancialtheories. ThestresstestingsimulationsfurthervalidatedtherobustnessofAI-drivenmodels, astheymaintainedstrongpredictiveaccuracyevenunderextremeeconomic conditions.Unliketraditionalmodels,whichexhibitedsignificantperformance degradationincrisisscenarios,deeplearningmodelsdemonstratedbetter adaptabilityandresilience. ComparisonwithExistingLiterature Theresultsalignwithpriorresearchthathighlightsthelimitationsoftraditional econometricmodelsincapturingfinancialdistress.Previousstudieshaveshown thatVectorAutoregression(VAR)andLogisticRegressionmodelsstruggleto handlenon-linearrelationshipsandsuddenmarketshifts(Acharyaetal.,2020). Ourfindingsconfirmthis,astraditionalmodelsunderperformedinhigh-stress scenarios. ResearchbyGoodelletal.(2021)suggestedthatmachinelearningmodelsoffer significantimprovementsinfinancialriskforecasting.However,mostpriorstudies havefocusedonsupervisedlearningapproacheslikerandomforestsandsupport vectormachines(SVMs).Thisstudyexpandstheliteraturebydemonstratingthat deeplearningmodels,particularlyTransformernetworks,provideevengreater predictiveaccuracy. Furthermore,recentadvancementsinexplainableAI(XAI)haveaddressedthe “black-box”natureofdeeplearningmodels(LópezdePrado,2022).Ouruseof SHAPanalysiscontributestothisgrowingfieldbyimprovingtheinterpretabilityof AI-drivenfinancialstresstesting,makingitmoreviableforregulatoryapplications. ImplicationsofFindings Thestudy’sfindingshavesignificantimplicationsforfinancialinstitutions, regulators,andriskmanagementstrategies. 1.ImprovedFinancialStressTestingFrameworks
